title: 103_s210
content: LIMITATION OF COST-OF-LIVING ADJUSTMENTS for pay for members of Congress and certain senior federal officials. Members of Congress and certain senior federal officials have limitations on cost-of-living adjustments for their pay. The adjustment is based on the percentage change in the ECI and is rounded to the nearest multiple of $100. The cost-of-living adjustment for Members of Congress and senior federal officials is determined by the percentage change in the ECI or the maximum percentage increase under the Social Security Act. The adjustment is rounded to the nearest multiple of $100 and takes effect at the beginning of the fiscal year. The adjustment in rates of pay under the General Schedule takes effect at the beginning of the fiscal year, with the first adjustment in 1995 and subsequent adjustments every 2 years. Executive Schedule Officers' pay rates are adjusted at the beginning of the first applicable pay period after the adjustment under section 5303 of title 5. The Executive Schedule Officers' pay rates are adjusted at the beginning of the first applicable pay period following the adjustment under section 5303 of title 5, United States Code. The adjustment is based on the percentage change in the ECI, rounded to the nearest multiple of $100. The per annum salary of the Vice President is adjusted based on the percentage change in the ECI or the maximum percentage increase determined under the Social Security Act for the applicable year. The adjustment takes effect at the beginning of the fiscal year following the adjustment under section 5303 of title 5, United States Code. The Vice President's salary is adjusted annually based on the ECI or the maximum increase under the Social Security Act. The adjustment takes effect at the start of the fiscal year following the adjustment in the General Schedule pay rates. The Vice President's salary is adjusted annually based on the ECI or the maximum increase under the Social Security Act, starting at the beginning of the fiscal year following the adjustment in the General Schedule pay rates. The Vice President's salary is adjusted annually based on the ECI or the maximum increase under the Social Security Act, starting at the beginning of the fiscal year following the adjustment in the General Schedule pay rates. The appropriate date for the adjustment is the first day of the fiscal year. LIMITATION ON COST-OF-LIVING ADJUSTMENTS FOR FEDERAL ANNUITIES FOR MEMBERS OF CONGRESS AND CERTAIN SENIOR FEDERAL OFFICIALS. The text chunk discusses amendments to the Civil Service Retirement System and the Federal Employees' Retirement System regarding adjustments to annuities based on creditable service, particularly for Members or positions under the Executive Schedule. The adjustments are limited to the lesser of the percentage increase under the current section or the maximum percentage increase determined under the Social Security Act for the applicable year. The amendment limits adjustments to annuities based on creditable service for Members or positions under the Executive Schedule to the lesser of the percentage increase under the current section or the maximum percentage increase determined under the Social Security Act for the applicable year.
